node.title: High Court to examine murder defence available to NT police officer
node.alt: Constable Zachary Rolfe walks in front of another man outside the NT Supreme Court.
node.description: This morning the full bench of the High Court in Canberra will sit to hear arguments over which defences should be available to NT police officer Constable Zachary Rolfe when he faces a murder trial next year.
node.content:
["Lawyers for Northern Territory police officer Zachary Rolfe will go head-to-head with prosecutors in the High Court in Canberra today in a battle over what he can argue in his defence, when he faces trial over the alleged murder of teenager Kumanjayi Walker in 2019.", "Zachary Rolfe, 30, had travelled to the remote Northern Territory community of Yuendumu, 300km north-west of Alice Springs, in November 2019 when the Indigenous teen\u00a0was shot three times.", "Constable Rolfe now faces charges of murder\u00a0or, in the alternative, manslaughter plus\u00a0committing a violent act causing death.", "Mr Rolfe has pleaded not guilty to all charges.", "The trial was originally scheduled to begin in July 2021\u00a0but, due to COVID-19 restrictions and a High Court battle over which legal defences will be\u00a0available to Constable Rolfe, the trial has been rescheduled for some time in 2022.", "In August, the full bench\u00a0of the Northern Territory Supreme Court ruled that Constable Rolfe could use three separate defences in the trial, including that he should not be held criminally liable for Mr Walker's death, because he was acting \"in good faith\" in his role as a police officer at the time the 19-year-old was shot.", "However,\u00a0before the trial could begin, prosecutors took the matter to the High Court, seeking to pause the trial while they challenged that decision.", "High Court Justice Rebecca Gleeson agreed, ruling in August that the trial be paused, until the High Court could make a decision about whether or not the \"good faith\"\u00a0defence was available to Constable Rolfe.", "The case was later referred to the full bench for today's hearing, which has been expedited, in a bid to clear the way for a trial.", "", "
The High Court ruling in August came less than an hour before the trial was scheduled to go ahead.(ABC News: Elise Pianegonda)
", "In written submissions to the High Court, Northern Territory prosecutors said the full bench\u00a0decision to allow Mr Rolfe to use the \"good faith\"\u00a0argument was flawed.", "\"On the Full Court's construction \u2026 the respondent police officer could avoid liability for the murder of an Indigenous man without any consideration by the jury as to whether the use of lethal force was reasonable,\" their submission\u00a0said.", "The submissions went\u00a0on to point to the danger of misinterpreting the provision, from the perspective of those on the receiving end.", "However, Mr Rolfe's lawyers will tell the High Court that\u00a0the NT Supreme Court arrived at the only reasonable interpretation of the relevant\u00a0act.", "\"The requirement for a police officer to be acting in good faith provides protection against the unwarranted application of this statutory defence and is an answer to the appellant's contention that to permit the construction applied by the Full Court would eviscerate protections against the alleged unlawful actions of police, or emasculate the careful protection that the law offers citizens against excessive police force,\" their submission\u00a0said.", "\"The relevant test for the jury in determining whether to acquit the respondent is whether the respondent, by reason of section 148B of the PA Act, acted in good faith.\"", "Lawyers for the Northern Territory told the court there were two similar cases in South Australia, which had been adjourned pending the outcome of the High Court challenge.", "The hearing is expected to run for a day, but it is not known when there will be a decision or when the way will be cleared for a trial."]
